channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Multiple Potholes, 25th January
item.description:
About 30m stretch of road with MULTIPLE potholes (A few attached in images). Road is cracked in places, overall difficult stretch to drive down as potholes on both sides of single track lane. Can see where previous potholes have been filled in (been an issue for many years), and where road is sinking it causes it to wear away. Overall, needs resurfacing to stop more every winter & stop people having flat tyres!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 2 Claydon Farm Cottage Claydon Lane, Claydon
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Signs on the road are completely worn, 25th January
item.description:
The yellow hatched box and the arrows/signs for what lane to be in for the roundabout are barely visible to the point you can hardly tell the hatched box is there so people are waiting in it and cars cannot get out of smyths.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 593 Princess Elizabeth Way, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Junction box damaged, 25th January
item.description:
Junction box has been knocked over exposing cables.

item.title: Potholes & road falling apart, 25th January
item.description:
Road is STILL in very poor condition despite recent reports. I have just spent Â£200 on new tyres, can I ask you to do the same on the roads please.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 31 Greenway Lane, Ullenwood

item.title: V large pothole, 25th January
item.description:
Please fix this pothole ASAP! It has been here for months and nothing has been done about it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): A436, Birdlip
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement collapsing around BT chamber, 25th January
item.description:
Queens Road, Cheltenham - between entrances to no. 18 and The Folly. Large crack in tarmac pavement and subsided pavement surface around BT inspection chamber in pavement. First noticed before Christmas, has got a lot worse in past week.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 20 Queen's Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 big pot holes in close succession, 24th January
item.description:
They Needs to be sorted, speed limit of 60mph is going to cause serious damage and possibly accidents
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): A40, The Reddings

item.title: Crossing not working, 24th January
item.description:
Hey, I use this crossing to get to work but it hasn't been working lately. I believe it still works from the Baker & Graze side but not from the Farrow & Ball side. Thanks, Nick
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 9 Suffolk Road, Cheltenham

item.title: Loose manhole cover in road- very noisy, 24th January
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 2 Saint George's Place, Cheltenham

item.title: V deep pothole, 24th January
item.description:

item.title: Maintenance of pillar box, 24th January
item.description:
The pillar box is in poor condition, having apparently not been properly painted, including adequate preparation, for years. Please arrange for this to be rectified.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 66 Church Road, Leckhampton
